decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Walking Ballista to gain infinite life and deal infinite damage to your opponent. By using cards like Collected Company and Ranger-Captain of Eos to tutor for combo pieces, as well as cards like Skyclave Apparition and Conclave Mentor for disruption and support, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while also maintaining board presence and developing its mana base through cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise.

This combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder combo to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature. Utilizing cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl to ramp, alongside Collected Company to dig for combo pieces, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents while gaining an insurmountable life total. The inclusion of Auriok Champion and Conclave Mentor adds resilience and additional synergies to the deck, making it a powerful force in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on aggressively using its early game creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Death's Shadow to deal damage quickly and disrup the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize. It also utilizes cards like Scourge of the Skyclaves and Tarmogoyf to maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for card advantage and recursion, creating a versatile and potent aggro strategy that can quickly overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, Sprite Dragon, and Stormwing Entity along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Wild Slash to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw spells like Serum Visions and Light Up the Stage to maintain card advantage. With a focus on speed and aggression, this UR Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow to enable powerful combos involving Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift. By bringing out multiple mountains from the deck at once, the player can deal immense amounts of damage to the opponent in one turn, often leading to a quick victory. The deck also includes removal spells like Anger of the Gods and Lightning Bolt to control the board and protect the combo. It aims to win the game through explosive turns and efficient use of its resources.

The main idea of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Shriekhorn. By doing so, it enables the player to bring back powerful creatures like Narcomoeba, Bloodghast, and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard to the battlefield. This deck aims to generate a lot of value from the graveyard, while also being able to deal damage with cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate. The key strategy is to consistently dredge cards into the graveyard and abuse the graveyard recursion to overwhelm the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo involving Colossus Hammer and Puresteel Paladin to quickly equip a creature with a huge power boost and go for a fast win. The deck also relies on Stoneforge Mystic to search for key equipment pieces and Giver of Runes to protect the combo pieces. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable companion for additional recursion. The deck aims to be aggressive and efficient in dealing damage to achieve victory in a quick and decisive manner.

This Spirit Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Spirit creatures while utilizing disruptive spells like Spell Queller and Skyclave Apparition to control the board. Drogskol Captain boosts the team and protects them with hexproof, while Aether Vial speeds up mana costs. Cavern of Souls ensures uncounterable spells, and the deck also includes some removal with Path to Exile. The land base is built for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and resilience in the mid to late game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while ramping up to play Scapeshift and win the game by sacrificing lands to deal lethal damage with Valakut triggers. The deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan, disrupt their strategy, and eventually overwhelm them with a powerful combo finish. The use of Wrenn and Six adds additional card advantage and Brazen Borrower offers versatility in dealing with threats. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents for a decisive victory.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost, high-power creatures like Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves. This is complemented by efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to clear the way for attacks. Cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek help disrupt the opponent's game plan. Mishra's Bauble provides card advantage and synergizes well with the deck's graveyard mechanics. The overall strategy is to lower your own life total to pump up your creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to put early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their hand with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push, Assassin's Trophy, and Lightning Bolt while also gaining incremental advantage with planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provides additional disruption and a strong threat, while Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze help close out the game with their size and ability to grow over time.

The key strategy of this deck is to utilize fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Stormwing Entity, combined with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Crash Through, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes a lot of cheap burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to both control the board and finish off the opponent. By using card draw and mana ramp like Manamorphose and Serum Visions, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) in order to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful colorless creatures like Karn Liberated, Karn, the Great Creator, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also utilizes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to help find the necessary Tron lands, while cards like Thragtusk and Wurmcoil Engine provide additional threats and life gain. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards using cards like Street Wraith and Windcaller Aven, while also controlling the board with cards like Force of Negation. The goal is to fill up the graveyard with creatures and then cast spells like Violent Outburst or Ardent Plea to bring them all back into play at once with Living End, overwhelming the opponent and swinging for lethal damage in one turn. The deck also utilizes a few control elements like Brazen Borrower and Curator of Mysteries to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck functions by utilizing graveyard recursion and sacrificing creatures to fuel powerful combos and overwhelm the opponent with an army of recurring creatures. By filling the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Life from the Loam, the deck can quickly bring back creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam, while also dealing damage with cards like Creeping Chill. The goal is to quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively, relying on speed and synergy to secure a victory.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Seasoned Pyromancer. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Lightning Bolt, while generating card advantage with planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six. Klothys, God of Destiny provides additional value and reach, while Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger adds a recursive threat to close out games. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's aggressive game plan.
